reviews.review_msg: Unfair; picks his favs; a right answer is the one which he agrees with; free thought is not allowed; not a very fair marker. AVOID HIM!!!

liked how he allows us to do creative responses to the novels. found him very approachable and his lectures engaging and not boring at all, (especially because he's actually interested in the subject himself and conveys that to his students).

Really, really dislike Paulo. Ego takes up entire lecture hall. Jokes around at students expense all class. Read Arabian Nights (wonderful material) however he wouldn't give more than a C to anyone who mentioned gender/sexism in any of their work (should be valid in arabian nights, as almost all women are ****s...) Picks favs.. Very unfair. AVOID!

You go to class to hear the same lecture worded differently. Discussions on (fairly easy) books simply touch the surface and nothing is in-depth. I think he's stupid although he acts like he's well-read and intelligent. I hope he gets fired. All you need to know is WL=lit read across the globe. I just saved you tons of $ and time. You're welcome.
Great Course! One of the best Professors at SFU. I also took WL 100 and was enjoyed it a lot, might major in WL!

After 2 semester w/ Paulo I've decided to major in WL. I have never met such a dedicated prof who is so passionate about what he teaches that students automatically become engaged in discussions. I don't understand the nasty comments about him cause in the 2semesters that I've had him none of the students in my classes ever felt that way about him.
This was a fantastic class.  Paulo knows the material through and through and is willing to give you the help you need.  I would take this class again in a second.

Prof. Horta is mean spirited.  His jokes are often not in good fun and he puts down students indirectly; such as by mentioneing that he knows more langauges or something, or how they haven't read Hamlet? Really? etc. Ego and arrogance combine for a nasty effect. But, his course materials can be interesting and he marks fairly overall.

Horta is a nightmare! The syllabus is good,but he manages to make you hate coming to class as they are excruciating and boring as hell. He blabbers on incoherently about everything else but the books, flirst with students and gets most of his facts wrong.He doesn't teach, just parades his ego. Although an easy class, avoid if you value your sanity!
loved reading DQ and other books, I mean Quixote... great course and excellent instructor.
i did not enjoy the teaching of the instrucotr, horta

I can only speak to the Arabian Nights course -- the best course I have taken so far at SFU. The enthusiasm and passion were contagious. There was no exam but only a journal of responses instead -- everyone was into it
this guy's a softie -- you'd pretty much have to skip class, not do readings, and not show up to the final to get into trouble.
horrible! i did not like this prof, horta, but course was neat.
he is an okay prof. he marks way too hard. he is pretty arrogant. i found his course too dificult. i am a good student.
great prof, too bad he got promoted and is gone!
Worst prof at SFU. I totally had a hard time listening to his bordenline-estoteric lectures and bearing with his ego! Luis Paulo Lemos Horta is not a cool prof!
fabulous, take anything from this guy. A pretty fair marker. Showing up to class and doing the readings does seem to be a pre-req to doing well, though.

Took the trickster and arabian nights courses while back. the prof was horrible. he does not know how to relate to other people. he marked us way too hard and made us read way to much. he borrowed money from students! and he totally played favourites.

my first thought was, a 900 page novel? you gotta be kidding. I'm in 4th year and noone ever asked me to read a book this long. But I loved Don Quixote & other books-- prof rides you hard so you expect a tough marker but he's actually a softie when you get your marks back

Very passionate about the subject and the work. At the time I was not happy with my grade, but as I graduate this term I'd say his Arabian Nights course was a fav. 
 
 Check out the Harryhausin Sinbad-they rock
His a nice person, but arrogant. He expects students to work a looooot. Not easy course.
he is a pretty witty prof...but i agree with a lot of the negative comments below...most students at sfu try to avoid him
I actually liked reading materials but found the course a bit scattered. Prof had a minor attitude problem. Don Quixote intereting though. Would not recommend
Worst teacher ever. Made us read way too much for a lower level course, and borrows money from students and never pays back!

Made us read 900 page novel (Don Quixotes) & I loved it. Handed out Cs like they were going out of style, but very fair. Excellent rapport with students. Those who did the readings love him -- not a prof to take if you're looking for the easy pass
I like the course materials but not the teacher, though he is smart
I am hating this class and especially the professor horta. He is parvenue, rude, and expects too much. I won't even get into a the ego of his. Do not take him course
hi paulo was a neat prof,very interesting. I think he is a fun teacher and I would take his course again.

He's a great prof, well knowledgable in his area, but you have to work hard in his class. He was always around for any extra help and is a reasonable marker. If you want easy marks, avoid his class, but if you want a rewarding class then I would recommend him.

Horta did DE on FirstClass and turned it into a semester-long amateur hour. Didn't respond to students for over a month. Had assignments due weekly that got no feedback. Didn't tell anybody what was up until a full month passed. The messageboard turned to a forum to slag his ineptitude. Not good.

Students don't like to do work, and Paulo expects students to do work. This is why students don't like him. The work pays off, and if you're confused, contact him. He will meet you anywhere any time, and even phone you to make sure he makes himself clear. 6 novels isn't too much to read in a class.

A very challenging prof, not for the faint of heart. Some previous reviews had the right words: arrogant, cold, pompous. But his reading lists are great and he really knows what he's talking about. Only take his class if you're really prepared for a challenge.

Thinks that his is the only class you're taking all term: enough reading for 2 courses in 1. Participate in class or he'll be grumpy, everyone will suffer. Make sure that what you say won't prompt him to say something like, "Is what you're about to say going to be relevant?" Agree with his opinions!

agree with all comments -- he's the best prof I've had at SFU and he's pushed me the hardest to produce good work.  If you'r looking for an easy credit, though, you'll get frustrated. Easy on the eyes but NOT on the marking!

he is helpful, smart, funny, and organized.  sounds like some people have a vendetta against him, but frankly, he isn't arrogant, and doesn't play favourites... sounds like the previous comments were all written by the same bitter student.  if you hate a prof, hate sheila delany.

Very bright but arrogant. Lectures were borderline esoteric...ok, more so than university-level classes should be!!! I wouldn't take his class again unless I had a translator with me. Subtly makes you feel dumb for not speaking 8 languages.

Paulo's was definately one of the more challenging classes i've ever taken at SFU, however what this meant is that he pushed me to work hard and produce one of the better major essays i've ever written. Class discussions were relevant and interesting.
This guy knows almost as much as he thinks de does. Smart, but very arrogant.  Self-important and cold--don't expect any compassion from him.

Smart guy.  Disaster as a teacher.  Called his fave students "The Fabulous 3."  Only talked to them.  Didn't return ANY graded work to some students all term.  Changed the exam format at the last second.  Never available.  Arrogant. Avoid.
Poor communications skills, unhelpful

"lets take literally a 5 min break" He plays favorites and decides that reading many novels isnt enough,and assigns other readings to make matters worse! Makes you do outside research if u dont speak up in class CLASS PARTICIPATION is a BIG ONE!
